result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Lemmermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca Lemmermann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 58 days in the House of Correction concurrent with credit for 58 (fifty-eight) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by December 19, 2016 or entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed. Court ordered DNA surcharge after today's proceedings.

Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).

-20 day appeal given,

-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

HONORABLE JUDGE GUOLEE (RESERVED BRANCH 31) FOR RESERVED BRANCH 21.

Defendant Rebecca Lemmermann in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Defendant Rebecca Lemmermann in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM OZAUKEE COUNTY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 21.    Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Angel Lee Johnson in court, Defendant Rebecca Lemmermann not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from Ozaukee County for purposes of this hearing.   Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angel Lee Johnson in court, defendant Rebecca Lemmermann not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michelle L. or the address listed on the criminal complaint

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Rebecca Lemmermann in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Rebecca Lemmermann in custody.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Per Deputy Wargolet, defendant is in-custody, file sent to in-custody court.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/15/15 @ 1:30pm
